intro: Gomphia iteodes, commonly known as the slender gomphia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a dense, spherical head. Gomphia iteodes is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive, fluffy appearance.
